alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 12:11PM EST until January 04 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and fields along the creek from near Cumming in south Forsyth County to Alpharetta and Roswell in north Fulton County. Additional portions of The Big Creek Greenway have minor flooding with 1 to 2 feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths will be closed, especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Monday was 8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 2.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
